Name.label: Rare tumor of liver and intrahepatic biliary tract

TextSection.Contents: A malignant hepatic tumor, typically affecting the pediatric population, characterized by anorexia, weight loss and an enlarged abdomen. This disorder is more common in patients with familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP), and can occur in patients with other pre-existing liver conditions. About 5 % of cases are associated with genetic factors, especially overgrowth syndromes, such as Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome (BWS) or hemihypertrophy.

Name.label: NTBT (narrower term maps to a broader term)
